Assuring Energy Transportation Network Services With NETSCOUT

NETSCOUT's nGeniusONE® Service Assurance platform helped SCADA troubleshooting of energy transport network issue without downtime.

Want Your UC&C System to Live Up to Expectations?

As users have become increasingly reliant on UC&C systems, the need to ensure these communications are reliable, while at the same time remaining completely secure, is paramount.

Electric Utility Provider Leverages NETSCOUT’s Solution to Assure Private 4G LTE Environment

NETSCOUT’s Service Assurance Platform Enabled separation and monitoring of key power infrastructure devices with the use of APN (Access Point Name) technology.

Private University Ensures Quality Student Experience With NETSCOUT

The widely distributed campuses of this institution presented challenges even before the recent emphasis on remote learning. NETSCOUT's nGeniusONE® Service Assurance platform and nGeniusONE® Visibility-as-a-Service (VaaS) were the solution to these challenges, providing service assurance for the applications required, and the solution optimizes the amount of instructional time actually available in remote learning scenarios.

How Edge Monitoring Will Support Successful 5G Rollout

Smart data and a centralized view of performance from RAN to edge to core are vital for service providers as they roll out their 5G networks.

Threat Intelligence: Applying Actionable Information to Current Threats

Meet the leadership of our world-class ATLAS Security and Engineering Research Team (ASERT) and learn how they see the evolving threat landscape. We’ll discuss research on DDoS, botnets, and malware, providing much-needed context to the overall threat environment. Understand how NETSCOUT Threat Intelligence is uniquely targeted and curated to provide DDoS protection and mitigation tightly integrated into our solutions protecting the world's largest and most complex networks.

Growing Reliance on UC&C Systems Puts IT Pros to the Test

In order to manage the performance and security needs associated with complex UC&C systems, IT needs a holistic view into the interconnected broader environment.

Using Network-Derived Data for Net/Sec Ops Collaboration & Cyber Threat Investigation

Comprehensive network visibility is a requirement for effective service assurance and cybersecurity. In this panel, our team of cybersecurity experts will discuss the value of using a common source of network-derived metadata and packets to enable NetSecOps collaboration and complement other cybersecurity technologies (i.e., SIEM, SOAR, EDR) for highly contextualized network-based threat investigation.

Leading Financial Assures Remote Office Access to Business Services With nGeniusPULSE

NETSCOUT nGenius®PULSE Active and Standby Virtual Server Appliances economically enhanced high-level IT monitoring and troubleshooting across remote office locations.

Reducing Manufacturing Plant Loss With Service Edge Visibility

NETSCOUT nGeniusONE® Service Assurance platform helped manufacturer reduce plant loss and improve plant floor operations productivity.

Today’s New Business Normal Creates Threat Opportunities

In the wake of COVID-19, enterprises need to develop short- and long-term strategies to counteract shifting threats to networks and applications.

Will the Tokyo Games Be a Target for Cyber Extortionists?

Modern-day games such as the summer event in Tokyo require a massive digital infrastructure, from telecommunications to digital scoring and video streaming. That makes them juicy targets for cybercriminals.

NETSCOUT Launches Industry-First Smart Edge Monitoring

NETSCOUT has reimagined service assurance for the hybrid enterprise with NETSCOUT Smart Edge Monitoring—a new, patent-pending architecture that combines smart data analytics with synthetic transaction testing.

One of the Largest ISPs in the US Assists Customers With DDoS Protection Through Patrolling the Network Edge

Due to the growth in cloud services and Over The Top (OTT)’ content, network traffic at most Internet Service Providers (ISPs) is being redirected to the edge of the network to decrease the costs associated with traversing the network. ISPs need to do a better job at protecting the network edge as it is not typically protected against DDoS attacks as comprehensively as the core centers of the network.

Our New DDoS Normal Isn’t All That Normal

Attack frequency has dropped, but we are nowhere near the numbers considered normal prior to COVID-19: Threat actors launched approximately 5.4 million DDoS attacks in the first half of 2021.
